sequenceSummary

Class Percentile<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • sequenceSummary.Percentile<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type to find the percentile over (must implement Comparable interface)
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    SummaryStatistic<T>

    public class Percentile<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements SummaryStatistic<T>
    A percentile object provides a utility for finding the nth percentile over an array of objects. The percentile can be found by sorting the objects, then iterating until the relevant element is found. For example, if we have 201 objects and the Percentile represented is the median (percentile = .5), then we would return the 100th object. Note that if there are an even number of objects, the median (or other percentiles) may be ambiguous; choose the lower value. For example, if there are 200 objects and percentile = .5, return the 100th element.

      • getValue

        public T getValue(T[] arr)
                                           throws SequenceSummaryException
        Description copied from interface: SummaryStatistic
        Returns the summary statistic's value over the array arr. For example, if the summary statistic is the median (50th percentile), and the summary statistic is over a set of pixel objects, then arr would be an array of pixels and this would return the median pixel of the array arr.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface SummaryStatistic<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
        Returns:
        the summary statistic over arr
        Throws:
        SequenceSummaryException
